verb.description: (of a solvent) enter into reversible chemical combination with (a dissolved molecule, ion, etc.)
examples: water can solvate both cations and anions
the ions become solvated in the water, that is, they become hydrated

noun.description: A more or less loosely bonded complex formed between a solvent and a dissolved species.

origin: Early 20th century: formed irregularly from solve + -ate.
